intro: Hiraea anisopetala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hiraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Hiraea anisopetala is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
